last_episode_to_air.name: The Family Hour
last_episode_to_air.overview: Lois and Clark turn to Lois's father as they battle infertility problems; a telekinetic ex-con turns his mind into a deadly weapon.

name: Lois & Clark: The New Adventures of Superman
original_name: Lois & Clark: The New Adventures of Superman
overview: A much more lavish version of the popular Superman television series which had first aired forty years earlier, Lois & Clark focused more on the Man of Steel's early adult years in Metropolis. With the unknowing help of Lois Lane, Clark Kent created Superman there in Metropolis after finding work at the world-famous Daily Planet newspaper, where he meets fellow reporter Lois Lane.

episodes.name: Pilot
episodes.overview: Clark Kent becomes embroiled in a story involving Lex Luthor and a plot to sabotage a space launch.

episodes.name: Strange Visitor (From Another Planet)
episodes.overview: A probe into alien threats to national security leads to the Daily Planet--and a search for Superman.

episodes.name: Neverending Battle
episodes.overview: Perry White orders the Daily Planeteers to draw out Superman, but Lex  may be one step ahead.

episodes.name: I'm Looking Through You
episodes.overview: More than one "invisible man" terrorizes Metropolis; and Lois feels invisible to Superman, whose visibility as a celebrity has its price.

episodes.name: Requiem for a Superhero
episodes.overview: Lois kills a story exposing a fight scandal because its publication could get her father, a sports surgeon, killed.

episodes.name: I've Got a Crush on You
episodes.overview: Lois and Clark go undercover at a nightclub to find out about a connection between the owners of the club and a group of arsonists called the "Toasters".  Superman is able to put out the "Toasters" permanently.

episodes.name: Smart Kids
episodes.overview: A group of children who are drugging themselves by an experimental drug to increase the intelligence begins to bring problems to Metropolis. Clark is worried because the children told him that they know he is Superman.

episodes.name: The Green, Green Glow of Home
episodes.overview: A friend of Jonathan and Martha has found a strange meteorite. Jason Trask is back and now he is in Smallville, looking for this meteorite that can destroy Superman. Lois and Clark go to Smallville to investigate the story and Clark introduces her to his parents.

episodes.name: The Man of Steel Bars
episodes.overview: Metropolis is hit with a strong heat wave in the middle of winter, and people believe that Superman is the cause. Lex Luthor is ultimately behind the heat and wants to see Superman gone.  Clark decides to leave Metropolis, but Lois finds out that the Luthor nuclear plant is to blame.

episodes.name: Pheromone, My Lovely
episodes.overview: An ex-lover of Lex Luthor spreads a perfume in the Daily Planet and everybody begins to fall in love with each other. Lois falls for Clark, the only one who isn't affected by the perfume and he tries not to take advantage of her. Without the perfume effects, Lex tells Nigel that he is in love with Lois.

episodes.name: Honeymoon in Metropolis
episodes.overview: Lois and Clark go undercover as honeymooners to a Metropolis hotel in an attempt to find out about a possible conspiracy which seems to involve a powerful congressman. They also need to learn how to share their lives with someone.

episodes.name: All Shook Up
episodes.overview: Superman loses his memory--and awareness of his superhuman abilities--in a cosmic collision with an asteroid heading straight for Earth.

episodes.name: Witness
episodes.overview: Lois' life is in danger when she witnesses the murderer of a scientist who was claiming to know the secret to increased male potency. Now, Clark and Perry need to protect her from the murderer Mr. Make-up and from the scientist's affair from the past : Barbara Trevino.

episodes.name: Illusions of Grandeur
episodes.overview: Lois and Clark need to find out the truth about the kidnapping of rich children who are disappearing in a magic box. A magician hypnotizes Superman and Lois, who is now in risk of life.

episodes.name: The Ides of Metropolis
episodes.overview: Lois helps a convicted murderer (but he is innocent) allowing him to stay at her house. He is the only one with the cure for a destructive new computer virus that is a menace for Metropolis. Jonathan worries that Martha might be having an affair and comes to Clark's apartment.

episodes.name: Foundling
episodes.overview: The globe from Clark's spaceship begins to give him some information regarding his past, but the globe is stolen for two kids before he can learn much. Lex Luthor buys the globe from Jack and begins to learn something about Superman, but not too much.

episodes.name: The Rival
episodes.overview: A Lois' ex-colleague is working for another newspaper who is strangely getting the major news before the Daily Planet and Lois gets jealous when she shows interest on Clark.

episodes.name: Vatman
episodes.overview: Lex Luthor builds a clone of Superman, and teaches him to do what he wants, and what Lex wants is to destroy the real Superman.

episodes.name: Fly Hard
episodes.overview: A group of terrorists take Clark, Lois, Perry, Jimmy, Jack and Lex hostage in the Daily Planet and Clark is not able do anything with his Superman powers or the others will figure out his secret identity.

episodes.name: Barbarians at the Planet
episodes.overview: Lex throws Lois for a loop by proposing marriage. Meanwhile, Clark smells a rat when Lex "saves" the Daily Planet from going under.

episodes.name: The House of Luthor
episodes.overview: Lois's mom arrives for her daughter's wedding to Lex, but Lois's pals have other plans.

episodes.name: Madame Ex
episodes.overview: Luthor's ex-wife, Arianna, comes to Metropolis and creates an exact, but evil copy of Lois. The real Lois, with Clark, begins to investigate who's behind this creation. She discovers that Lex was already married when he tried to marry her. Arianna tries to kill Superman, because she believes he is responsible for Lex Luthor's death.

episodes.name: Wall of Sound
episodes.overview: A man genious in the sound area creates a sound weapon that can affect Metropolis and Superman. Clark is nominated for the Kerth Awards, and Lois gets mad because she won this prize three years in a row and now she won't get the prize.

episodes.name: The Source
episodes.overview: When Lois fails to protect her source, she is suspended from the Daily Planet. Now, Lois and Clark need to work to find the criminal and restore her good reputation as reporter.

episodes.name: The Prankster
episodes.overview: Clark needs to protect Lois against a man she sent to jail five years ago, and what this man wants more is revenge.

episodes.name: Church of Metropolis
episodes.overview: The ""Intergang"", a new criminal organization tries to control south Metropolis and  Superman is powerless because of their threats against everyone closest to him. Lois gets jealous when the investigator in charge, Mayson Drake, begins to show interest in Clark.

episodes.name: Operation Blackout
episodes.overview: Lois and Clark discover an terrorist operation to infiltrate the military Fort Truman and hijack a satellite. Now, they are targets of a supposely dead boyfriend of one of Lois' best school friends.

episodes.name: That Old Gang of Mine
episodes.overview: Al Capone, John Dillinger, Bonnie and Clyde return from the dead by the hands of  a scientist. They start a crime wave in Metropolis and when one of them shoots Clark, he needs to fake his own death to protect his identity.

episodes.name: A Bolt from the Blue
episodes.overview: When Superman tries to save a man from suicide, a lightning strikes both. Few minutes later, the man is very strong and can fly...yeah, now he has Superman's powers too. Then he decides to be a superhero, and tries to make money with his ""advantages"", leaving Superman very mad about this. As soon as Dr. Gretchen Kelly finds out about this, she makes a plan to re-duplicate the lightning incident and kidnaps Lois to attract Superman.

episodes.name: Season's Greedings
episodes.overview: A fired and vengeful toyman creates a toy which can make the adults act like children, and sure, all the Daily Planet gang will be affected too, even Clark.

episodes.name: Metallo
episodes.overview: Lucy Lane is working in Metropolis again, and now she has a new boyfriend named Johnny. He's turned into a cyborg body powered with kryptonite by the hands of two doctors. When Johnny finds out what he really is now, he tries to defeat Superman.

episodes.name: Chi of Steel
episodes.overview: Lois and Clark investigate several robberies commited by a thief  who is a ninja with mystical bracelets. These bracelets can give to a person power to kill Superman, using a mystical power named Chi.

episodes.name: The Eyes Have It
episodes.overview: Two scientists make Superman blind with a beam of light in his eyes, now Lois needs to take care of him on her house, while everybody think that Clark is in the mountains with Mayson Drake.

episodes.name: The Phoenix
episodes.overview: Lex is back from the dead by the hands of Dr. Gretchen Kelly, and now he wants to get Lois back and destroy Superman. Clark asks Lois out on a date, but, when she accepts, Perry sends them in a stakeout. Then, Lois and Clark call it the ""almost first date"".

episodes.name: Top Copy
episodes.overview: When a famous television reporter (and also an assassin from the Intergang) finds out Superman's true identity, she wants to show the information to the world. How will Clark hide the truth from the world now?

episodes.name: Return of the Prankster
episodes.overview: When the Prankster escapes the prison, he continues with his plans to torment Lois' life, and now he also wants to kidnap the president of the United States.

episodes.name: Lucky Leon
episodes.overview: When Jimmy is falsely accused by murder, Lois and Clark need to prove that he is innocent and clear his name. And they finally go to their ""real"" first date. Everything was going well, but when Clark takes Lois home, she closes the door on his face...because the date was great and because her fears about what will happen with their relationship. After they prove Jimmy's innocence, Lois explains to Clark what she felt when she closed the door on his face, and recognizes the mistake. When they finally kiss, a shocking and tragic thing happens.

episodes.name: Resurrection
episodes.overview: A scientist develops a pill to ""ressurrect"" some ""dead"" criminal men in Metropolis. Clark is jealous because a man who is trying to solve Mayson's murder shows interest on Lois, and she thinks he is attractive.

episodes.name: Tempus Fugitive
episodes.overview: Lois and Clark need to travel to 1966 with the help of H.G. Wells and his time machine to prevent a villain from the future who wants to destroy the baby Superman. The villain tells Lois about Clark's most important secret...his secret identity!

episodes.name: Target: Jimmy Olsen!
episodes.overview: Jimmy becomes a part of a experimental project by two ladies who want to put the people at their control. Lois is mad with all the Clark's suddenly disappearances and begins to date Scardino.

episodes.name: Individual Responsibility
episodes.overview: The Intergang, now headed by Bill Church Jr., kidnaps Perry when Franklin Stern refuses to sell the Daily Planet and Superman allows the kidnap because he's affected with the strange ""Red Kryptonite"" effects. When Clark gets upset with Lois and Scardino's dates, he asks her out again.

episodes.name: Whine, Whine, Whine
episodes.overview: Superman saves the life of a musician, but instead of ""thank you"", the musician wants to sue him because he ""broke"" his arm. Then, many people of Metropolis begins to fake injures caused by Superman. After finally give up of her love for Superman, Lois needs to choose who's the one she is going to be together with : Clark Kent or Dan Scardino.

episodes.name: And the Answer Is...
episodes.overview: Superman's real identity is in danger of being exposed by a diary written by a man from the future. Clark finally asks Lois to marry him, but the question she asks is even bigger.

episodes.name: We Have a Lot to Talk About
episodes.overview: Will Lois accept Clark's marriage proposal? The question lingers while Metropolis becomes strangely crime-free.

episodes.name: Ordinary People
episodes.overview: As headless corpses begin turning up in Metropolis, Lois and Clark escape from the grisly headlines to a tropical island.

episodes.name: Contact
episodes.overview: Lois claims to have been abducted by aliens, and Superman feels powerless to help when she slips into trances.

episodes.name: When Irish Eyes Are Killing
episodes.overview: Lois tries to convince Clark that his decision to break up is a mistake. When an old Lois' friend comes to Metropolis, she tries to make Clark jealous. But this friend has plans to use her in a Druid sacrifice. Clark finally realizes that he can't stay without Lois, but that may be too late now.

episodes.name: Just Say Noah
episodes.overview: Lois and Clark go undercover as husband and wife to investigate missing couples in the Larry Smiley Institute, a place to help couples to repair problems in their marriages. They will find Larry's true plans and will find their romance again.

episodes.name: Don't Tug on Superman's Cape
episodes.overview: Lois and Clark decide to forget the word "marriage", at least for the time. One of the richest couples of Metropolis has a plan to capture and add Superman to their collection of treasures. They capture Lois to get Superman. In the cage, Lois and Clark begin to talk, and the conversation makes them start to lose their fears about marriage.

episodes.name: Ultra Woman
episodes.overview: Using a red-kryptonite laser, two evil sisters inadvertently empower Lois as Metropolis's newest superhero--Ultra Woman.

episodes.name: Chip Off the Old Clark
episodes.overview: Now engaged, Lois and Clark get relationship problems when a woman claims to have had a child of Superman. Clark tells Lois the kid isn't his, but when Lois is interviewing the woman, the kid pick up a sofa. In who will Lois believe now?

episodes.name: Super Mann
episodes.overview: When Lois and Clark finally begin with the wedding plans, they must stop again and investigate a Nazi organization which is trying to take over Metropolis.

episodes.name: Virtually Destroyed
episodes.overview: A computer genius traps Lois and Clark in virtual reality. He believes Lois has the access codes for Lex Luthor's computer system. Superman must rely on Jimmy's skills to help save her.

episodes.name: Home Is Where the Hurt Is
episodes.overview: Lois and Clark's parents show up to spend Christmas with them. Mindy Church reorganizes the Intergang and creates a Kryptonian virus to make Superman die. Now and for the first time in his life Clark is sick, but this sickness can kill him, unless Sam Lane helps him with a risky recovering process.

episodes.name: Never on Sunday
episodes.overview: Ellen Lane hires a wedding coordinator to help on Lois and Clark's wedding, now the plans for a small ceremony are gone...And a magician with designs on vengeance is now in Metropolis against some people, including Clark.

episodes.name: The Dad Who Came in from the Cold
episodes.overview: Jimmy's father appears in Metropolis and Jimmy introduces him to Clark, Lois and Perry. When Lois and Clark discover that he is a spy, they must tell the truth to Jimmy, but he doesn't believe them. Clark gets worried about the ""father"" subject...he doesn't know if he is going to be a good father because of his job.

episodes.name: Tempus, Anyone?
episodes.overview: Time traveler Tempus returns to snatch Lois away to a parallel universe, where she links up with H.G. Wells--and a more cynical Clark.

episodes.name: I Now Pronounce You...
episodes.overview: Just before their wedding, Lois and Clark probe the theft of exotic amphibians, which leads them to a freakish biologist and a plot to assassinate the President.

episodes.name: Double Jeopardy
episodes.overview: Sparks aren't flying in Clark's marriage. Meanwhile, Lois's life plays out like a bad novel after Lex escapes from prison.

episodes.name: Seconds
episodes.overview: Superman declares war on the maniacal Lex over Lois, who is being primed to kill her superhero.

episodes.name: Forget Me Not
episodes.overview: While at a sanitarium to regain her memory, Lois becomes a candidate for a sinister doctor's behavior experiments.

episodes.name: Oedipus Wrecks
episodes.overview: An electromagnetic surge opens a floodgate of memories for Lois just as Dr. Deter tries to purge all thoughts of Clark from her mind.

episodes.name: It's a Small World After All
episodes.overview: A vengeful former classmate, armed with a formula to shrink her enemies, proves no small worry for Lois at their high-school reunion.

episodes.name: Through a Glass, Darkly
episodes.overview: A terrorist, together with a Planet researcher, create chaos for Superman, just as he's waxing nostalgic for a sense of permanence in his life.

episodes.name: Big Girls Don't Fly
episodes.overview: As the aliens bring Superman knowledge of his past and his destiny, a terrifying assassin is dispatched to dispose of the superhero. Meanwhile, Lois fears that Clark is drifting away from her.

episodes.name: Lord of the Flys (1)
episodes.overview: Superman leaves Earth for New Krypton to aid inhabitants of his homeland in their civil war against the sinister Lord Nor. Meanwhile, in Smallville, Nor holds Clark's parents hostage as slaves.

episodes.name: Battleground Earth (2)
episodes.overview: After Superman is unmasked as an impostor in a Kryptonian tribunal, the Man of Steel faces Nor in mortal combat.

episodes.name: Swear to God, This Time We're Not Kidding
episodes.overview: The Wedding Destroyer arrives as Lois and Clark prepare to settle down in marriage.

episodes.name: Soul Mates
episodes.overview: As the newlyweds are about to consummate their marriage, time traveler H.G. Wells arrives with news that a curse threatens to strike them down.

episodes.name: Brutal Youth
episodes.overview: Superman's eternal youth may intimidate Lois, but the super-power is eagerly sought by a gerontologist, an aging bank robber--and Jimmy.

episodes.name: The People vs. Lois Lane (1)
episodes.overview: Lois holds the smoking gun when an informant is shot down during a meeting with her.

episodes.name: Dead Lois Walking (2)
episodes.overview: Superman helps Lois break out of prison, only to encounter the wrath of the vengeful Prof. Cole--who plots to annihilate Metropolis.

episodes.name: Bob and Carol and Lois and Clark
episodes.overview: The newlyweds get chummy with a new couple  as Superman encounters a new adversary--known as Deathstroke.

episodes.name: Ghosts
episodes.overview: A con artist is after the Kents' brownstone, and he summons the ghost of a woman who was murdered there to scare the couple away.

episodes.name: Stop the Presses
episodes.overview: A new editor takes over Perry's office; and a computer hacker taps into classified files to learn the source of Superman's powers--and kill him.

episodes.name: 'Twas the Night Before Mxymas
episodes.overview: An elfin visitor puts Daily Planet Christmas Eve partygoers into a time loop--and plunges the city into hopelessness and despair.

episodes.name: Lethal Weapon
episodes.overview: Just as an extortionist threatens to level Metropolis, Superman's powers go haywire, thanks to exposure to red kryptonite.

episodes.name: Sex, Lies and Videotape
episodes.overview: Superman wins a peace prize--and then sees his reputation crumble with the publication of a scandalous photo of himself with Lois.

episodes.name: Meet John Doe (1)
episodes.overview: Tempus, the time traveler, returns to Metropolis as a Presidential candidate bent on controlling the minds of the masses.

episodes.name: Lois and Clarks (2)
episodes.overview: With Superman lost in a time warp, an alternate Superman from another dimension helps Lois combat the diabolical Tempus, the new President-elect.

episodes.name: AKA Superman
episodes.overview: Jimmy's new girlfriend is a Superman fan who thinks that Jimmy is the disguised Man of Steel.

episodes.name: Faster than a Speeding Vixen (1)
episodes.overview: Superman contends with a tough female competitor; the Planet gets a new owner; and corporate CEOs begin disappearing.

episodes.name: Shadow of a Doubt (2)
episodes.overview: Clark finds evidence that someone is planning to take over Lex Luthor's empire.

episodes.name: Voice from the Past (3)
episodes.overview: Lois and Clark move to confront Leslie about his true identity, but a power-hungry maniac suddenly begins controlling Lois's mind.

episodes.name: I've Got You Under My Skin
episodes.overview: A robber trying to hide out from the mob switches bodies with an unsuspecting Clark and discovers that the Man of Steel's superpowers come with the package.

episodes.name: Toy Story
episodes.overview: Toys are involved in the abductions of orphans, Dr. Klein and the daughter of a toy-company board member.

episodes.name: The Family Hour
episodes.overview: Lois and Clark turn to Lois's father as they battle infertility problems; a telekinetic ex-con turns his mind into a deadly weapon.
